page.title: 17TRANSPORT
page.content: A small proportion of the village people use the local bus service. This leaves the village at 9.45am and returnes 12.45pm on Wednesday and Saturday. This means just 2 hours shopping time in Dorchester and many find that it is inadequate for their needs. It is a regret that there are no evening buses. Most people would like transport to Dorchester, half as many to Yeovil and others to Maiden Newton. Transport is needed for shopping, entertainment, work and evening classes. The majority off households have a car and there is a high number of 2 car families. Nearly half of the households of the village have no car available during the working day. Many people feel that a community minibus would be nan asset to the village.
